newsitem.title: UK: Britain lagging in investment - newspaper.
newsitem.headline: Britain lagging in investment - newspaper.

text.p: Britain's investment performance is weaker than that of its main industrial competitors, the Independent newspaper said on Thursday.

The Independent said a joint report by the Machine Tool Technologies Association and Oxford Economic Forecasting showed that investment as a proportion of gross domestic product is below other countries including the U.S, Japan, Germany and Taiwan.

The report said the cumulative effect of lower investment meant that the amount of capital per worker in the UK, defined as the amount of plant and equipment each person has to work with, was less than half the German level and lower than Taiwan.

The joint report criticised a government White Paper (discussion document) on competitiveness published in June, which showed British investment on a par with Germany and France and ahead of the U.S., as being misleading.
